shaper_tab.help_text:
Input Shaper is a technology that helps reduce vibrations in a 3D printer during printing.

Vibrations can cause defects on the model, such as 'ghosting'. Input Shaper analyzes the printer's movements and adjusts them to minimize these vibrations.

How it works?
1. Load accelerometer data.
2. The program selects the best 'shaper'.
3. Copy the settings.

Result: smoother printing and fewer defects!

settings_tab.interpolation_factor_desc: Interpolation factor determines the smoothness of 3D visualization (higher value = prettier graph, but more load)
settings_tab.hardware_info:
• Screw pitch determines how much height changes per full turn
• Tape thickness affects the calculation of layers for compensation
• Min/max adjustment limits the range of suggested changes
settings_tab.thresholds_info:
1. If deviation > screw threshold, the program suggests screw adjustment
2. If after screw adjustment deviation > tape threshold,
   the program suggests additional tape correction
3. If deviation < screw threshold but > tape threshold,
   the program suggests only tape correction
settings_tab.visualization_info:
• Interpolation factor determines the smoothness of 3D visualization
  (higher value = prettier graph, but more load)

• Display settings allow choosing units for screw adjustment instructions (minutes and/or degrees)
settings_tab.display_options_error:
At least one display option (minutes or degrees) must be enabled.
Both options have been enabled by default.
settings_tab.environment_info:
Temperature difference between measurement and printing can warp the bed.
Use the coefficient to control the strength and direction of the simulated dome (negative values invert the curvature).

visual_rec.instructions:
IMPORTANT! Bed orientation:
• FRONT side - closer to you (where the control panel is)
• BACK side - further from you (rear of the printer)

1. Locate the four corner screws on your bed (see screw adjustment scheme).
2. Check the "Mode" caption above the scheme — it tells you whether you are turning screws or nuts.
3. Follow the rotation arrows on the cards; they already account for the chosen mode.
4. After adjusting screws, follow the tape application scheme for final correction.
5. After all adjustments, re-measure the bed to verify results.

• Re-run the bed mesh
